title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Central Bank Act 1942 (Section
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Central Bank Act 1942 (Section 

32D) (Certain Financial Vehicles Dedicated Levy) Regulations 2021. 
(2) These Regulations come into operation on 8th July 2021.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited central bank act 1942 (section 32d) (certain financial vehicle dedicated levy) regulation 2021 (2) regulation come operation 8th july 2021

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: In these Regulations:
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations: 

“authorisation” means an authorisation, licence or any other permission granted 
by the Bank pursuant to any provision of the designated enactments and 
designated statutory instruments, and includes registration; 

“Bank” means Central Bank of Ireland; 

"certain financial vehicle" means – 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

an Irish collective asset-management vehicle, 

a unit trust, 

a credit union, 

(d) 

an investment limited partnership, or 

(e) 

a common contractual fund; 

“common contractual fund” means a common contractual fund as defined in 
section 6 of the Investment Funds, Companies and Miscellaneous Provisions Act 
2005; 

“credit union” means a credit union within the meaning of section 2 of the Credit 
Union Act 1997; 

“due date” means the day that falls 28 days after the date of issue of the levy 
notice, as specified on such levy notice. 

“dedicated levy contribution” means the amount determined by the Bank as 
being due and owing by a regulated entity in respect of an authorisation and 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 13th July, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [335] 3 

which is calculated in accordance with the Schedule to these Regulations or 
further regulations made under section 32D of the Principal Act, as applicable; 

"investment limited partnership" means a partnership which holds a certificate 
of authorisation issued in accordance with the Investment Limited Partnership 
Act 1994; 

“Irish collective asset-management vehicle” means a body registered as such 
under the Irish Collective Asset-management Vehicles Act 2015. 

“levy notice” means each notice specifying one or more levy contributions 
and/or supplementary levy contributions sent by the Bank to a regulated entity; 

“Principal Act” means the Central Bank Act 1942 (No. 22 of 1942); 

“regulated entity” means a certain financial vehicle; 

“unit trust” means – 

(a) 

(b) 

a unit trust scheme within the meaning of the Unit Trusts Act 
1990 (No. 37 of 1990), or 

an undertaking for collective investment in transferable securities 
(within the meaning of the UCITS Regulations), that is 
constituted of a unit trust (within the meaning of the UCITS 
Regulations) and authorised under those Regulations.

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: 3. A regulated entity is liable to pay to the Bank the dedicated levy
text_raw:
3. A regulated entity is liable to pay to the Bank the dedicated levy 
contribution prescribed in the Schedule to these Regulations on or before the 
due date.
text_norm: 3 regulated entity liable pay bank dedicated levy contribution prescribed schedule regulation due date

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: 4. A regulated entity is liable to pay the dedicated levy contribution
text_raw:
4. A regulated entity is liable to pay the dedicated levy contribution 
prescribed in the Schedule to these Regulations whether or not a levy notice has 
been issued by the Bank under Regulation 5.
text_norm: 4 regulated entity liable pay dedicated levy contribution prescribed schedule regulation whether levy notice issued bank regulation 5

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: 5. Subject to Regulation 6, the Bank may send to a regulated entity a
text_raw:
5. Subject to Regulation 6, the Bank may send to a regulated entity a 

dedicated levy notice specifying, for the relevant period: 

(a) 

the dedicated levy contribution assessed by the Bank to be 
payable by that regulated entity, and 

(b) 

the due date for payment of the dedicated levy contribution.
text_norm: 5 subject regulation 6 bank may send regulated entity dedicated levy notice specifying relevant period (a) dedicated levy contribution assessed bank payable regulated entity (b) due date payment dedicated levy contribution

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: If no levy notice is received by a regulated entity by 1 September of any
text_raw:
6. 

If no levy notice is received by a regulated entity by 1 September of any 
year, then 1 October shall be the due date for the payment of the levy 
contribution by such regulated entity in that year.
text_norm: 6 levy notice received regulated entity 1 september year 1 october shall due date payment levy contribution regulated entity year

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: 7. The dedicated levy contribution and any interest accrued in accordance
text_raw:
7. The dedicated levy contribution and any interest accrued in accordance 
with Regulation 9 shall be paid by a regulated entity by cheque, direct bank 
transfer or equivalent electronic transfer of funds to a bank account specified by 
the Bank, or as is otherwise specified by the Bank. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [335]
text_norm: 7 dedicated levy contribution interest accrued accordance regulation 9 shall paid regulated entity cheque direct bank transfer equivalent electronic transfer fund bank account specified bank otherwise specified bank 4 335

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: 8. (1) A regulated entity may, no later than 21 days following a due date,
text_raw:
8. (1) A regulated entity may, no later than 21 days following a due date, 
submit an appeal under this Regulation in respect of the dedicated levy 
contribution payable by such entity. 

(2) The regulated entity must set out in writing the grounds of the appeal 

and should include supporting documentation. 

(3) The Bank may at its discretion waive or reduce a levy contribution or 
part thereof, or a supplementary levy contribution or part thereof, in exceptional 
circumstances on foot of an appeal pursuant to subsection (1). 

(4) The Bank shall advise the regulated entity in writing of its decision in 
respect of the appeal, providing reasons for same and details of any amount 
outstanding in respect of the disputed amount of dedicated levy contribution and 
the due date applicable for the payment of the dedicated levy contribution.
text_norm: 8 (1) regulated entity may later 21 day following due date submit appeal regulation respect dedicated levy contribution payable entity (2) regulated entity must set writing ground appeal include supporting documentation (3) bank may discretion waive reduce levy contribution part thereof supplementary levy contribution part thereof exceptional circumstance foot appeal pursuant subsection (1) (4) bank shall advise regulated entity writing decision respect appeal providing reason detail amount outstanding respect disputed amount dedicated levy contribution due date applicable payment dedicated levy contribution

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: 9. Without prejudice to any other remedy available to the Bank, where
text_raw:
9. Without prejudice to any other remedy available to the Bank, where 
payment for a dedicated levy contribution has not been received by the due date, 
interest shall accrue thereon in accordance with the provisions of the European 
Communities (Late Payment in Commercial Transactions) Regulations 2012 
(S.I. No. 580 of 2012) or any amending or replacing legislation.
text_norm: 9 without prejudice remedy available bank payment dedicated levy contribution received due date interest shall accrue thereon accordance provision european community (late payment commercial transactions) regulation 2012 (s.i no 580 2012) amending replacing legislation

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: 10. Every sum payable by a regulated entity under these Regulations,
text_raw:
10. Every sum payable by a regulated entity under these Regulations, 
including interest, for or on account of the Bank shall be recoverable by the Bank 
from that person as a simple contract debt in a court of competent jurisdiction.
text_norm: 10 every sum payable regulated entity regulation including interest account bank shall recoverable bank person simple contract debt court competent jurisdiction

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: 11. (1) A regulated entity shall keep full and true records of all transactions
text_raw:
11. (1) A regulated entity shall keep full and true records of all transactions 
which affect their liability under these Regulations and any related returns made. 

(2) A record kept by a person pursuant to paragraph (1) and, in the case of 
any such record that has been given by the person to another person, any copy 
thereof that is in the power or control of the first mentioned person shall be 
retained by that person for a period of 6 years from the date of the last transaction 
to which the record relates, provided that this Regulation shall not apply to 
records of a company that have been disposed of in accordance with section 707 
of the Companies Act 2014 (No. 38 of 2014). 

(3) No person shall, in purported compliance with a provision of these 
Regulations, provide an answer or explanation, make a statement or produce or 
deliver any return, certificate, balance sheet or other document which is false in 
a material particular.
text_norm: 11 (1) regulated entity shall keep full true record transaction affect liability regulation related return made (2) record kept person pursuant paragraph (1) case record given person another person copy thereof power control first mentioned person shall retained person period 6 year date last transaction record relates provided regulation shall apply record company disposed accordance section 707 company act 2014 (no 38 2014) (3) person shall purported compliance provision regulation provide answer explanation make statement produce deliver return certificate balance sheet document false material particular

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: 12. The Bank may exercise any of the powers and perform any of the
text_raw:
12. The Bank may exercise any of the powers and perform any of the 
functions and duties imposed on the Bank by these Regulations through or by 
any of the officers or employees of the Bank. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [335] 5
text_norm: 12 bank may exercise power perform function duty imposed bank regulation officer employee bank 335 5

title: of Corporate Entities) Regulations 2019 [S.I. No. 110 of 2019] as inserted by
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of the Regulations is to prescribe levies (‘dedicated levies’) to be 
paid by certain financial vehicles, and the moneys received by the Bank by way 
of such levies shall be used by it to defray expenses of the Bank associated with 
its functions under the Investment Limited Partnerships (Amendment) Act 2020 
and the European Union (Modifications of Statutory Instrument No. 110 of 
2019) (Registration of Beneficial Ownership of Certain Financial Vehicles) 
Regulations 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 8 [335]
